projectOverview.name: Web Snake Game
projectOverview.description: A lightweight, browser‑only Snake game implemented with plain HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. The game runs in a single page, requires no external libraries or frameworks, and supports basic gameplay: moving a snake, eating food, growing, and detecting collisions.

userStories.title: Start the game
userStories.description: As a player, I want to start a new game session so that I can play immediately.
acceptanceCriteria: A Start button is visible on the landing screen.
Pressing the Start button clears any previous state and shows the game canvas.
The first snake segment is positioned at the center of the canvas.

userStories.title: Control the snake
userStories.description: As a player, I want to move the snake using arrow keys (or swipe on mobile) so that I can navigate the play area.
acceptanceCriteria: Arrow keys change the snake’s direction instantly.
Swipe gestures on touch devices produce the same directional changes.
The snake cannot reverse direction directly (e.g., moving right → left immediately).

userStories.title: Eat food and grow
userStories.description: As a player, I want the snake to grow when it eats food and my score to increase so that I can track my progress.
acceptanceCriteria: Food appears at random positions not occupied by the snake.
When the snake’s head reaches food, the snake grows by one segment and a new food item spawns.
The score increments by 1 for each food eaten and is displayed on screen.

userStories.title: Detect collisions and end the game
userStories.description: As a player, I want the game to end when the snake collides with walls or itself so that I know the session is over.
acceptanceCriteria: Collision with the canvas boundary triggers a Game Over state.
Collision with any part of the snake’s body triggers a Game Over state.
A Game Over message is displayed with the final score.

userStories.title: Restart after game over
userStories.description: As a player, I want to restart the game after a Game Over so that I can try again.
acceptanceCriteria: A Restart button appears in the Game Over screen.
Pressing Restart resets the snake, score, and food to initial state.

userStories.title: Responsive layout
userStories.description: As a player on mobile devices, I want the game to adapt to screen size so that I can play comfortably.
acceptanceCriteria: Canvas scales to fit the viewport while maintaining a square aspect ratio.
Controls (arrow keys or swipe) work on touch devices.

functionalRequirements.description: Render a square game area (canvas) of configurable size (default 400x400px).
Implement a game loop using `requestAnimationFrame` that updates the snake’s position at a constant speed (e.g., 10 frames per second).
Generate food at random grid positions ensuring it does not overlap the snake body.
Handle keyboard input (Arrow keys) and touch input (swipe) to change snake direction.
Detect collision with canvas boundaries and snake body segments.
Maintain a score counter that increments on food consumption.
Display current score in a UI element.
Show Game Over overlay with final score and Restart button.
Reset all game state when Restart is pressed.
Ensure the entire codebase is written in plain HTML, CSS, and vanilla JavaScript (no external libraries).

nonFunctionalRequirements.description: Performance: The game must run smoothly at 60 FPS on modern browsers.
Compatibility: Must support latest versions of Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge, and mobile browsers (iOS Safari, Android Chrome).
Accessibility: Keyboard controls must be operable with standard arrow keys and screen reader focus must be on the canvas during gameplay.
Maintainability: All code should be modular, with clear separation between game logic, rendering, and input handling.
Security: The code must not expose any external network requests or use unsafe eval patterns.

businessRules.description: The snake’s initial length is 3 segments.
The game board is divided into a grid (e.g., 20x20 cells); snake movement occurs cell by cell.
Food appears only in empty cells; no two food items can exist simultaneously.
The snake cannot reverse direction (e.g., from left to right) in a single frame.
Score is displayed as a numeric value and resets to 0 on each new game.

successCriteria.description: The game loads in under 2 seconds on a standard broadband connection.
All user stories pass acceptance tests (see criteria above).
No console errors or warnings appear during gameplay.
The game runs without lag or stutter on at least 50% of devices tested (desktop and mobile).
Code passes linting with ESLint (standard configuration) and is documented with inline comments.
